intro: Hippion viscosum, commonly known as the sticky hippion, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems that secrete a sticky substance, which can trap small insects. Its flowers are typically showy, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. The sticky resin produced by the plant has been used traditionally in some indigenous communities for various purposes.
